start.intro: It's important that your TV is turned on before you continue.
start.title: Finding device...
start.ipAddressDescription: Ensure that the IP address of your TV does not change by assigning it a static address in your router based on the MAC address.
start.constructionYearDescription: This is important because it will determine which version of the API is used to communicate with your TV. TV's before 2016 don't require a pairing process. If your device is being added but you're not able to send commands to it, it might be that you need to select the newer version.

authenticate.intro: Enter the code displayed on the TV

verify.errorDescription:
The on/off behaviour of the TV might not work as expected if Wake-on-LAN is not enabled.
When your TV is put on standby you'll be able to send commands to it for about 10 minutes before it turns off completely. Without Wake-on-LAN there'll be no way to turn your TV back on.

error.pairingTimeout: The pairing session has expired, please try again.
error.endpointNotFound: Was able to reach the TV but not the API. The API version is probably incorrect.
error.hostUnreachable: Could not reach the TV on this IP address. Is the IP correct and the TV turned on? Otherwise try a different API version.
error.connectionTimedOut: The connection to the TV timed out. Is the IP correct and the TV turned on? Otherwise try a different API version.
error.concurrentPairing: Concurrent pairing process already in progress, wait 60 seconds and try again.
